Description: Attic pottery squat lekythos, restored. Black monochrome except for reserved band beneath the handle containing two thin black bands. Some of the paint has fired red.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Sir William Matthew Flinders Petrie
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Fine Arts, Boston. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Fairbanks 1928 / Early Vases preceding Athenian Black Figure Ware (p. 131, no. 364, pl. XXXIX)
Robinson 1893 / Catalogue of Greek, Etruscan and Roman Vases (p. 237, no. 235)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.1963)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Museum of Fine Arts, Boston
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: P.5705 (Pottery & Porcelain Ledger No.)
